title: Hash Functions & Collisions
subject: Data Structures
theory:
Collision happens when Hash(k1) == Hash(k2). 
Resolutions:
1. **Chaining**: Store Linked List at bucket.
2. **Open Addressing**: Find next empty slot (Linear Probing).

interview_questions.question: How does Java resolve collisions?
interview_questions.answer: It uses Chaining. Since Java 8, if chain > 8, it converts list to Red-Black Tree for O(log n).

summary: Handling collisions gracefully ensures O(1) performance.
